metadata.title: Specify Multiple Remote chronyd NTP Servers for Time Data
metadata.description: Multiple chronyd NTP Servers for time synchronization should be specified.

criteria.comment: chrony.conf conditions are met

metadata.title: Specify a Remote NTP Server for Time Data
metadata.description: A remote NTP Server for time synchronization should be specified (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: chrony.conf conditions are met

metadata.title: Disable Ctrl-Alt-Del Reboot Activation
metadata.description: By default, the system will reboot when the Ctrl-Alt-Del key sequence is pressed.

metadata.title: Package audit Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package audit should be installed.

metadata.title: Package chrony Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package chrony should be installed.

metadata.title: Package cronie Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package cronie should be installed.

metadata.title: Package firewalld Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package firewalld should be installed.

metadata.title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
metadata.description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate group.

criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root group

metadata.title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
metadata.description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate user.

criterion.comment: Check if all system log files are owned by root user

metadata.title: Confirm Existence and Permissions of System Log Files
metadata.description: File permissions for all syslog log files should be set correctly.

criterion.comment: Check permissions of all system log files

metadata.title: Disable X Windows Startup By Setting Default SystemD Target
metadata.description: Checks /etc/systemd/system/default.target to ensure that the default runlevel target is set to multi-user.target.

metadata.title: Service sshd Disabled
metadata.description: The sshd service should be disabled.

criteria.comment: package openssh-server removed or service sshd is not configured to start

metadata.title: Package libreswan Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package libreswan should be installed.

metadata.title: Service auditd Enabled
metadata.description: The auditd service should be enabled if possible.

criteria.comment: package audit installed and service auditd is configured to start
service auditd is configured to start

metadata.title: Service chronyd Enabled
metadata.description: The chronyd service should be enabled if possible.

criteria.comment: package chrony installed and service chronyd is configured to start
service chronyd is configured to start

metadata.title: Service crond Enabled
metadata.description: The crond service should be enabled if possible.

criteria.comment: package cronie installed and service crond is configured to start
service crond is configured to start

metadata.title: Service firewalld Enabled
metadata.description: The firewalld service should be enabled if possible.

criteria.comment: package firewalld installed and service firewalld is configured to start
service firewalld is configured to start

metadata.title: Set All Accounts To Have Unique Names
metadata.description: All accounts on the system should have unique names for proper accountability.

criteria.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The maximum password age policy should meet minimum requirements.

criteria.comment: The value PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The minimum password age policy should be set appropriately.

criteria.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

metadata.title: UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
metadata.description: Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.

criterion.comment: tests that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

metadata.title: All Password Hashes Shadowed
metadata.description: All password hashes should be shadowed.

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The password minimum length should be set appropriately.

metadata.title: Set Password dcredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password dcredit should meet minimum requirements

criteria.comment: conditions for dcredit are satisfied

metadata.title: Set Password difok Requirements
metadata.description: The password difok should meet minimum requirements

criteria.comment: conditions for difok are satisfied

metadata.title: Set Password lcredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password lcredit should meet minimum requirements

criteria.comment: conditions for lcredit are satisfied

metadata.title: Set Password maxclassrepeat Requirements
metadata.description: The password maxclassrepeat should meet minimum requirements using pam_pwquality

criteria.comment: conditions for maxclassrepeat are satisfied

metadata.title: Set Password maxrepeat Requirements
metadata.description: The password maxrepeat should meet minimum requirements using pam_pwquality

criteria.comment: conditions for maxrepeat are satisfied

metadata.title: Set Password minclass Requirements
metadata.description: The password minclass should meet the minimum requirements

criteria.comment: conditions for minclass are satisfied

metadata.title: Set Password minlen Requirements
metadata.description: The password minlen should meet minimum requirements

criteria.comment: system uses pam_pwquality configured

metadata.title: Set Password ocredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password ocredit should meet minimum requirements

criteria.comment: conditions for ocredit are satisfied

metadata.title: Check pam_pwquality Existence in system-auth
metadata.description: Check that pam_pwquality.so exists in system-auth

metadata.title: Set Password retry Requirements
metadata.description: The password retry should meet minimum requirements

criteria.comment: Conditions for retry are satisfied
system is RHEL6 with pam_cracklib configured
system is RHEL7 with pam_pwquality configured
system is Fedora with pam_pwquality configured

metadata.title: Set Password ucredit Requirements
metadata.description: The password ucredit should meet minimum requirements

criteria.comment: conditions for ucredit are satisfied

metadata.title: Limit Password Reuse
metadata.description: The passwords to remember should be set correctly.

criteria.comment: remember parameter of pam_unix.so or pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly

criterion.comment: remember parameter of pam_unix.so is set correctly
remember parameter of pam_pwhistory.so is set correctly

metadata.title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
metadata.description: The password expiration warning age should be set appropriately.

metadata.title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
metadata.description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

criterion.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of system-auth
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of password-auth

metadata.title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
metadata.description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Write permissions are disabled for group and other in all directories in Root's Path
metadata.description: Check each directory in root's path and make use it does not grant write permission to group and other

criteria.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

criterion.comment: Check for write permission to group and other in root's path

metadata.title: Aide Database Must Exist
metadata.description: The aide database must be initialized.

metadata.title: Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
metadata.description: Test if auditctl is in use for audit rules.

metadata.title: Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
metadata.description: Test if augenrules is enabled for audit rules.

metadata.title: Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - chmod
metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.title: Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - fremovexattr
metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.title: Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - fsetxattr
metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.title: Audit Discretionary Access Control Modification Events - lchown
metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.description: The changing of file permissions and attributes should be audited.

metadata.title: Record Any Attempts to Run chcon
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of chcon is enabled.

metadata.title: Record Any Attempts to Run restorecon
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of restorecon is enabled.

metadata.title: Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of semanage is enabled.

metadata.title: Record Any Attempts to Run setsebool
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of setsebool is enabled.

metadata.title: Audit File Deletion Events
metadata.description: Audit files deletion events.

metadata.title: Audit File Deletion Events - rename
metadata.description: The deletion of files should be audited.

metadata.title: Audit File Deletion Events - renameat
metadata.description: The deletion of files should be audited.

metadata.title: Audit File Deletion Events - rmdir
metadata.description: The deletion of files should be audited.

metadata.title: Audit File Deletion Events - unlink
metadata.description: The deletion of files should be audited.

metadata.title: Audit File Deletion Events - unlinkat
metadata.description: The deletion of files should be audited.

metadata.title: Make Audit Configuration Immutable
metadata.description: Force a reboot to change audit rules is enabled

metadata.title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading
metadata.description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

metadata.title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - delete_module
metadata.description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

metadata.title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - init_module
metadata.description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

metadata.title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - insmod
metadata.description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

metadata.title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - modprobe
metadata.description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

metadata.title: Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - rmmod
metadata.description: The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events
metadata.description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - faillock
metadata.description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - lastlog
metadata.description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - tallylog
metadata.description: Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.

metadata.title: Record Events that Modify the System's Mandatory Access Controls
metadata.description: Audit rules that detect changes to the system's mandatory access controls (SELinux) are enabled.

metadata.title: Audit Information Export To Media
metadata.description: Audit rules that detect the mounting of filesystems should be enabled.

metadata.title: Record Events that Modify the System's Network Environment
metadata.description: The network environment should not be modified by anything other than administrator action. Any change to network parameters should be audited.

metadata.title: Record Events that Modify the System's Network Environment
metadata.description: The network environment should not be modified by anything other than administrator action. Any change to network parameters should be audited.

metadata.title: Record Events that Modify the System's Network Environment
metadata.description: The network environment should not be modified by anything other than administrator action. Any change to network parameters should be audited.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of privileged commands are enabled.

criterion.comment: audit augenrules binaries count matches rules count
audit auditctl binaries count matches rules count

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - chage
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of chage is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - chsh
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of chsh is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - crontab
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of crontab is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - gpasswd
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of gpasswd is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - newgrp
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of newgrp is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - pam_timestamp_check
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of pam_timestamp_check is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - passwd
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of passwd is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - postdrop
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of postdrop is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - postqueue
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of postqueue is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - pt_chown
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of pt_chown is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - ssh_keysign
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of ssh_keysign is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - su
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of su is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - sudo
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of sudo is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - sudoedit
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of sudoedit is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - umount
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of umount is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - unix_chkpwd
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of unix_chkpwd is enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - userhelper
metadata.description: Audit rules about the information on the use of userhelper is enabled.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Process and Session Initiation Information
metadata.description: Audit rules should capture information about session initiation.

metadata.title: Audit System Administrator Actions
metadata.description: Audit actions taken by system administrators on the system.

metadata.title: Shutdown System When Auditing Failures Occur
metadata.description: The system will shutdown when auditing fails.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Adjtimex
metadata.description: Record attempts to alter time through adjtimex.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Clock_settime
metadata.description: Record attempts to alter time through clock_settime.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Settimeofday
metadata.description: Record attempts to alter time through settimeofday.

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through Stime
metadata.description: Record attempts to alter time through stime. Note that on 64-bit architectures the stime system call is not defined in the audit system calls lookup table.

criteria.comment: 32-bit or 64-bit system
audit augenrules or audit auditctl
audit augenrules stime
audit auditctl stime

metadata.title: Record Attempts to Alter Time Through the Localtime File
metadata.description: Record attempts to alter time through /etc/localtime.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful)
metadata.description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - creat
metadata.description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - ftruncate
metadata.description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - open
metadata.description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - open_by_handle_at
metadata.description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - openat
metadata.description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

metadata.title: Ensure auditd Collects Unauthorized Access Attempts to Files (unsuccessful) - truncate
metadata.description: Audit rules about the unauthorized access attempts to files (unsuccessful) are enabled.

metadata.title: Audit User/Group Modification
metadata.description: Audit user/group modification.

metadata.title: The syslog Plugin Of the Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
metadata.description: active setting in /etc/audisp/plugins.d/syslog.conf is set to 'yes'

metadata.title: 'log_group' Not Set To 'root' In /etc/audit/auditd.conf
metadata.description: Verify 'log_group' is not set to 'root' in /etc/audit/auditd.conf.

metadata.title: Auditd Email Account to Notify Upon Action
metadata.description: action_mail_acct setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain account

metadata.title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk is Low on Space
metadata.description: admin_space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

metadata.title: Auditd Maximum Log File Size
metadata.description: max_log_file setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

metadata.title: Auditd Action to Take When Maximum Log Size Reached
metadata.description: max_log_file_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

metadata.title: Auditd Maximum Number of Logs to Retain
metadata.description: num_logs setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

metadata.title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Starting to Run Low on Space
metadata.description: space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

metadata.title: System Login Banner Compliance
metadata.description: The system login banner text should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Enable Auditing for Processes Which Start Prior to the Audit Daemon
metadata.description: Look for argument audit=1 in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

criterion.comment: check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for audit=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT

metadata.title: Verify GRUB_DISABLE_RECOVERY Set to true
metadata.description: GRUB_DISABLE_RECOVERY set to 'true' in /etc/default/grub

metadata.title: Disable Kernel Support for USB via Bootloader Configuration
metadata.description: Look for 'nousb' argument in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub

metadata.title: Set Boot Loader Password
metadata.description: The grub2 boot loader should have password protection enabled.

criterion.comment: make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg
make sure a superuser is defined in /boot/grub2/grub.cfg

metadata.title: Set the UEFI Boot Loader Password
metadata.description: The UEFI grub2 boot loader should have password protection enabled.

criterion.comment: make sure a password is defined in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg
make sure a superuser is defined in /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

metadata.title: Enable GNOME3 Login Warning Banner
metadata.description: Enable the GNOME3 Login warning banner.

criteria.comment: Enable GUI banner and prevent user from changing it

metadata.title: Disable GNOME3 Automounting
metadata.description: The system's default desktop environment, GNOME3, will mount devices and removable media (such as DVDs, CDs and USB flash drives) whenever they are inserted into the system. Disable automount and autorun within GNOME3.

criteria.comment: Disable GNOME3 automount/autorun and prevent user from changing it

criterion.comment: Prevent user from changing automount setting
Prevent user from changing automount-open setting
Prevent user from changing autorun setting

metadata.title: Disable Ctrl-Alt-Del Reboot Key Sequence in GNOME3
metadata.description: Disable the GNOME3 ctrl-alt-del reboot key sequence in GNOME3.

metadata.title: Disable Geolocation in GNOME3
metadata.description: Disable GNOME3 Geolocation for the clock and system.

metadata.title: Disable Power Settings in GNOME3
metadata.description: Disable GNOME3 power settings.

metadata.title: Disable the GNOME3 Login Restart and Shutdown Buttons
metadata.description: Disable the GNOME3 Login GUI Restart and Shutdown buttons to all users on the login screen.

criteria.comment: Disable GUI shutdown and restart buttons and prevent user from changing it

metadata.title: Disable All GNOME3 Thumbnailers
metadata.description: The system's default desktop environment, GNOME3, uses a number of different thumbnailer programs to generate thumbnails for any new or modified content in an opened folder. Disable the execution of these thumbnail applications within GNOME3.

criteria.comment: Disable Gnome3 Thumbnailers and prevent user from enabling

criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay

metadata.title: Disable User Administration in GNOME3
metadata.description: Disable GNOME3's ability to give users some administrative rights.

metadata.title: Disable the GNOME3 Login User List
metadata.description: Disable the GNOME3 GUI listing of all known users on the login screen.

criteria.comment: Disable GUI listing of known users and prevent user from changing it

metadata.title: Disable WIFI Network Connection Creation in GNOME3
metadata.description: Disable the GNOME3 wireless network creation settings.

metadata.title: Disable WIFI Network Notification in GNOME3
metadata.description: Disable the GNOME3 wireless network notification.

metadata.title: Enable the GNOME3 Login Smartcard Authentication
metadata.description: Enable smartcard authentication in the GNOME3 Login GUI.

criteria.comment: Enable smartcard authentication and prevent user from changing it

metadata.title: Enable GUI Warning Banner
metadata.description: Enable the GUI warning banner.

criteria.comment: Enable GUI banner and prevent user from changing it

metadata.title: Set the GNOME3 Login Number of Failures
metadata.description: Set the GNOME3 number of login failure attempts.

criteria.comment: Set number of login attempts and prevent user from changing it

metadata.title: Require Credential Prompting for Remote Access in GNOME3
metadata.description: Configure GNOME3 to require credential prompting for remote access.

metadata.title: Require Encryption for Remote Access in GNOME3
metadata.description: Configure GNOME3 to require encryption for remote access connections.

metadata.title: Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Idle Activation
metadata.description: Idle activation of the screen saver should be enabled.

criteria.comment: check screensaver idle activation and prevent user from changing it

criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay

metadata.title: Configure the GNOME3 GUI Screen locking
metadata.description: The allowed period of inactivity before the screensaver is activated.

criteria.comment: check screensaver idle delay and prevent user from changing it

criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay

metadata.title: Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Lock Delay After Idle Period
metadata.description: Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled immediately or after a delay.

criteria.comment: Enable screensaver lock and prevent user from changing it

criterion.comment: screensaver lock delay is set correctly
prevent user from changing screensaver lock delay

metadata.title: Enable GNOME3 Screensaver Lock After Idle Period
metadata.description: Idle activation of the screen lock should be enabled.

criteria.comment: Enable screensaver lock and prevent user from changing it

criterion.comment: screensaver lock prevent user from changing
screensaver lock delay is set correctly
prevent user from changing screensaver lock delay

metadata.title: Implement Blank Screensaver
metadata.description: The GNOME3 screensaver should be blank.

criteria.comment: Enable blank screensaver and prevent user from changing it

criterion.comment: screensaver prevent user from changing mode

metadata.title: Disable Full User Name on Splash Shield
metadata.description: GNOME3 screen splash shield should not display full name of logged in user.

criteria.comment: Disable screensaver user info and prevent user from changing it

metadata.title: Ensure Users Cannot Change GNOME3 Session Settings
metadata.description: Ensure that users cannot change GNOME3 session idle and lock settings.

criteria.comment: check screensaver idle delay and prevent user from changing it

criterion.comment: prevent user from changing idle delay
prevent user from changing screensaver lock delay

metadata.title: Verify that Interactive Boot is Disabled
metadata.description: The ability for users to perform interactive startups should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable Prelinking
metadata.description: The prelinking feature can interfere with the operation of checksum integrity tools (e.g. AIDE), mitigates the protection provided by ASLR, and requires additional CPU cycles by software upgrades.

criteria.comment: Conditions for prelinking disabled are satisfied
System is RHEL6 with prelinking disabled
System is RHEL7 or Fedora and prelink RPM is not installed or prelinking is disabled
System is RHEL7 or Fedora
prelink RPM package not installed or prelinking disabled

metadata.title: Disable Core Dumps
metadata.description: Core dumps for all users should be disabled

metadata.title: Set Last Login/Access Notification
metadata.description: Configure the system to notify users of last login/access using pam_lastlog.

metadata.title: Implement Local DB for DConf User Profile
metadata.description: The DConf User profile should have the local DB configured.

metadata.title: Ensure Yum gpgcheck Globally Activated
metadata.description: The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.

metadata.title: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled For All Yum or Dnf Package Repositories
metadata.description: Ensure all yum or dnf repositories utilize signature checking.

criteria.comment: ensure all yum or dnf repositories utilize signiature checking

criterion.comment: verify no gpgpcheck=0 present in /etc/yum.repos.d files

metadata.title: File grub.cfg Owned By root Group
metadata.description: The grub.cfg file should be owned by the root group. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

metadata.title: Verify that System Executables Have Root Ownership
metadata.description: Checks that /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, /usr/sbin, /usr/local/bin, /usr/local/sbin, /usr/libexec, and objects therein, are owned by root.

metadata.title: Verify that Shared Library Files Have Root Ownership
metadata.description: Checks that /lib, /lib64, /usr/lib, /usr/lib64, /lib/modules, and objects therein, are owned by root.

metadata.title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
metadata.description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

criteria.comment: directories are root owned
log_group in auditd.conf is not root

extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

metadata.title: Verify that System Executables Have Restrictive Permissions
metadata.description: Checks that binary files under /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, /usr/sbin, /usr/local/bin, /usr/local/sbin, and /usr/libexec are not group-writable or world-writable.

metadata.title: File grub.cfg Permissions
metadata.description: File permissions for grub.cfg should be set to 0600 (or stronger). By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

metadata.title: Proper Permissions User Home Directories
metadata.description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

metadata.title: Verify that Shared Library Files Have Restrictive Permissions
metadata.description: Checks that /lib, /lib64, /usr/lib, /usr/lib64, /lib/modules, and objects therein, are not group-writable or world-writable.

metadata.title: Find files unowned by a group
metadata.description: All files should be owned by a group

criterion.comment: Check all files and make sure they are owned by a group

metadata.title: File grub.cfg Owned By root User
metadata.description: The grub.cfg file should be owned by the root user. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub2/grub.cfg or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg

metadata.title: Banner for FTP Users
metadata.description: To trace malicious activity facilitated by the FTP service, it must be configured to ensure that all commands sent to the FTP server are logged using the verbose vsftpd log format.

criteria.comment: FTP is not being used or the conditions are met
FTP configuration conditions are not set or are met

metadata.title: Banner for FTP Users
metadata.description: This setting will cause the system greeting banner to be used for FTP connections as well.

metadata.title: All GIDs Are Present In /etc/group
metadata.description: All GIDs referenced in /etc/passwd must be defined in /etc/group.

metadata.title: Disable GDM Automatic Login
metadata.description: Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow users to automatically login.

metadata.title: Disable GDM Guest Login
metadata.description: Disable the GNOME Display Manager (GDM) ability to allow guest users to login.

metadata.title: Package Antivirus Installed
metadata.description: Antivirus software should be installed.

criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Package McAfeeVSEForLinux Installed
metadata.description: McAfee Antivirus software should be installed.

criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries and Linux Agent
metadata.description: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries (MFErt) and Linux Agent (MFEcma).

metadata.title: Install McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS)
metadata.description: McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS) software should be installed.

metadata.title: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM)
metadata.description: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM).

metadata.title: Install the Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module
metadata.description: Install the McAfee Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module if it is absolutely necessary. If SELinux is enabled, do not install or enable this module.

metadata.title: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module
metadata.description: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module.

metadata.title: CentOS 6
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is CentOS 6

extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

metadata.title: CentOS 7
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is CentOS 7

extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

criterion.comment: CPE vendor is 'fedoraproject' and product is 'fedora'

metadata.title: Installed operating system is part of the Unix family
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is part of the Unix OS family

criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6

metadata.title: WRLinux
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is Wind River Linux

criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

metadata.title: Check if the scan target is a container
metadata.description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it does then we consider to be a docker filesystem.

metadata.title: Check if the scan target is a machine
metadata.description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it doesn't then we consider to be host filesystem or virtual machine.

metadata.title: Disable dccp Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module dccp should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable usb-storage Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module usb-storage should be disabled.

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to /dev/shm
metadata.description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /dev/shm. The nodev mount option should be specified for /dev/shm.

metadata.title: Add noexec Option to /dev/shm
metadata.description: It can be dangerous to allow the execution of binaries from world-writable temporary storage directories such as /dev/shm. The noexec mount option prevents binaries from being executed out of /dev/shm.

metadata.title: Add nosuid Option to /dev/shm
metadata.description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /dev/shm. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to /tmp
metadata.description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /tmp. The nodev mount option should be specified for /tmp.

metadata.title: Add nosuid Option to /tmp
metadata.description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /tmp. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

metadata.title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
metadata.description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

metadata.title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
metadata.description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

metadata.title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
metadata.description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

metadata.title: Ensure insecure_locks is disabled
metadata.description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

metadata.title: Verify No netrc Files Exist
metadata.description: The .netrc files contain login information used to auto-login into FTP servers and reside in the user's home directory. Any .netrc files should be removed.

metadata.title: System Accounts Do Not Run a Shell
metadata.description: The root account is the only system account that should have a login shell.

criterion.comment: Test shell defined for UID from <0, UID_MIN -1>
Test shell defined for reserved system UIDs
Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs

metadata.title: Package dconf Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package dconf should be installed.

metadata.title: Package gdm Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package gdm should be installed.

metadata.title: Package net-snmp Removed
metadata.description: The RPM package net-snmp should be removed.

metadata.title: Package openssh-server Removed
metadata.description: The RPM package openssh-server should be removed.

metadata.title: Package prelink Removed
metadata.description: The RPM package prelink should be removed.

metadata.title: Package vsftpd Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package vsftpd should be installed.

metadata.title: Package xorg-x11-server-common Removed
metadata.description: The RPM package xorg-x11-server-common should be removed.

metadata.title: Require Authentication for Single-User Mode
metadata.description: The requirement for a password to boot into single-user mode should be configured correctly.

metadata.title: Restrict Serial Port Root Logins
metadata.description: Preventing direct root login to serial port interfaces helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

metadata.title: Verify File Hashes with RPM
metadata.description: Verify the RPM digests of system binaries using the RPM database.

metadata.title: Verify File Ownership And Permissions Using RPM
metadata.description: Verify the integrity of installed packages by comparing the installed files with information about the files taken from the package metadata stored in the RPM database.

criterion.comment: user ownership of all files matches local rpm database
group ownership of all files matches local rpm database
mode of all files matches local rpm database

metadata.title: Restrict Virtual Console Root Logins
metadata.description: Preventing direct root login to virtual console devices helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

metadata.title: Change the default firewalld zone to drop
metadata.description: Change the default firewalld zone to drop.

metadata.title: Set SHA512 Password Hashing Algorithm in /etc/login.defs
metadata.description: The password hashing algorithm should be set correctly in /etc/login.defs.

metadata.title: SNMP default communities disabled
metadata.description: SNMP default communities must be removed.

metadata.title: SNMP use newer protocols
metadata.description: SNMP version 1 and 2c must not be enabled.

metadata.title: Disable Empty Passwords
metadata.description: Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Disable SSH Support for Rhosts RSA Authentication
metadata.description: SSH can allow authentication through the obsolete rsh command through the use of the authenticating user's SSH keys. This should be disabled.

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Disable root Login via SSH
metadata.description: Root login via SSH should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Disable SSH Support for User Known Hosts
metadata.description: SSH can allow system users host-based authentication to connect to systems if a cache of the remote systems public keys are available. This should be disabled.

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Set OpenSSH Idle Timeout Interval
metadata.description: The SSH idle timeout interval should be set to an appropriate value.

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Set ClientAliveCountMax for User Logins
metadata.description: The SSH ClientAliveCountMax should be set to an appropriate value (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Kernel Runtime Parameter "kernel.exec-shield" Check
metadata.description: The kernel runtime parameter "kernel.exec-shield" should not be disabled and set to 1 on 32-bit systems.

criteria.comment: system is RHEL6

criterion.comment: kernel runtime parameter kernel.exec-shield set to 1
kernel runtime parameter kernel.exec-shield set to 1
NX is supported and is not disabled

metadata.title: Kernel Runtime Parameter IPv6 Check
metadata.description: Disables IPv6 for all network interfaces.

criteria.comment: IPv6 disabled or net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set correctly

metadata.title: Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" Parameter Runtime Check
metadata.description: The kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" parameter should be set to "1" in system runtime.

criterion.comment: kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1

metadata.title: Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" Parameter Configuration Check
metadata.description: The kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6" parameter should be set to "1" in the system configuration.

criterion.comment: kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
kernel static parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1 in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf

metadata.title: Test for 64-bit Architecture
metadata.description: Generic test for 64-bit architectures to be used by other tests

metadata.title: Test for PPC and PPCLE Architecture
metadata.description: Generic test for PPC PPC64LE architecture to be used by other tests

metadata.title: Test for x86 Architecture
metadata.description: Generic test for x86 architecture to be used by other tests

metadata.title: Test for x86_64 Architecture
metadata.description: Generic test for x86_64 architecture to be used by other tests
